etymology.description: 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") + 木(木) (mù, "tree") = wooden structure under a roof -> phonetic adaptation -> 宋
etymology.interpretation: The character 宋 combines the roof radical 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") with 木(木) (mù, "tree"), originally representing a wooden structure underneath a roof. It evolved to represent the name of the ancient Song dynasty and later as a common Chinese surname.

examples.chinese: 他姓宋(他姓宋)，家族历史悠久(家族歷史悠久)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xìng Sòng, jiāzú lìshǐ yōujiǔ.
examples.english: His surname is Song, and his family has a long history.

examples.chinese: 宋代文人雅士众多(宋代文人雅士眾多)，诗词歌赋流传千古(詩詞歌賦流傳千古)。
examples.pinyin: Sòngdài wénrén yǎshì zhòngduō, shīcí gēfù liúchuán qiāngu.
examples.english: During the Song dynasty, there were many refined scholars, and poems and lyrics have been passed down for ages.

examples.chinese: 书架上摆着宋瓷花瓶(書架上擺著宋瓷花瓶)，展现精湛工艺(展現精湛工藝)。
examples.pinyin: Shūjià shàng bǎi zhe Sòng cí huāpíng, zhǎnxiàn jīngzhàn gōngyì.
examples.english: On the bookshelf stands a Song porcelain vase, showcasing exquisite craftsmanship.
